Package circeIsland.creatures

Class Creature

java.lang.Object
java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
circeIsland.creatures.Creature
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Circe, Pig, Visitor
public abstract class Creature
extends java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double
The class represents the creature. All the moving creatures are extended from this class. It can move to X and Y directions
Author:
Jiwoo Kim
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Creature

      public Creature​(double xCoor, double yCoor, double ratioX, double ratioY)
      initialize the creatures. The creatures DOES NOT initialize the island they belong to velocity of the creatures are set to 10 (default)
      Parameters:
      xCoor - left coordinate for the creatures
      yCoor - up coordinate for the creatures
      ratioX - the number represents how many creatures fit horizontally in the island
      ratioY - the number represents how many creatures fit vertically in the island

    • Creature

      public Creature​(processing.core.PImage img, double xCoor, double yCoor, double ratioX, double ratioY)
      initialize the creatures. The creatures DOES NOT initialize the island they belong to velocity of the creatures are set to 10 (default)
      Parameters:
      img - image for creature
      xCoor - left coordinate for the creatures
      yCoor - up coordinate for the creatures
      ratioX - the number represents how many creatures fit horizontally in the island
      ratioY - the number represents how many creatures fit vertically in the island

    • Creature

      public Creature​(double xCoor, double yCoor, double ratioX, double ratioY, int vel)
      initialize the creatures. The creatures DOES NOT initialize the island they belong to
      Parameters:
      xCoor - left coordinate for the creatures
      yCoor - up coordinate for the creatures
      ratioX - the number represents how many creatures fit horizontally in the island
      ratioY - the number represents how many creatures fit vertically in the island
      vel - velocity of the creature

    • Creature

      public Creature​(processing.core.PImage img, double xCoor, double yCoor, double ratioX, double ratioY, int vel)
      initialize the creatures. The creatures DOES NOT initialize the island they belong to
      Parameters:
      img - image for creature
      xCoor - left coordinate for the creatures
      yCoor - up coordinate for the creatures
      ratioX - the number represents how many creatures fit horizontally in the island
      ratioY - the number represents how many creatures fit vertically in the island
      vel - velocity of the creature

  • Method Details

    • getIsInGrid

      public boolean getIsInGrid()
      Returns:
      true if creature is in the island. false otherwise.

    • getXGrid

      public int getXGrid()
      Returns:
      get the x grid coordinate of the creature

    • getYGrid

      public int getYGrid()
      Returns:
      get the y grid coordinate of the creature

    • getIsland

      public Island getIsland()
      Returns:
      get the island that creature is belong to. return null if it is not assigned yet.

    • moveX

      public void moveX​(int dir)
      If the creatures can move to desire direction, it will move. Stay other wise
      Parameters:
      dir - the horizontal direction the creatures will move

    • moveY

      public void moveY​(int dir)
      If the creatures can move to desire direction, it will move. Stay other wise
      Parameters:
      dir - the vertical direction the creatures will move

    • moveToXY

      public void moveToXY​(int x, int y)
      The creatures teleport to the spot (x,y)
      Parameters:
      x - x grid coordinate that creature teleports to
      y - y grid coordinate that creature teleports to

    • putOnIsland

      public void putOnIsland​(Island i)
      Initialize the island that creature belong to If the creature is not the instance of circe, it will also added into island array
      Parameters:
      i - island that creature belong to

    • removeFromIsland

      public void removeFromIsland()
      removing the belonged island from the creature. not only that, it will be removed from the island entirely
      Precondition:
      the creature is not the instance of Circe

    • getVel

      public int getVel()
      Returns:
      velocity of the creature

    • setVel

      public void setVel​(int vel)
      Set the velocity of the creature
      Parameters:
      vel - new velocity that creature will get

    • islandWidthResized

      public boolean islandWidthResized()
      Returns:
      whether the island width are resized or not (resize: true, otherwise: false)

    • islandHeightResized

      public boolean islandHeightResized()
      Returns:
      whether the island height resized or not. (resize: true, otherwise: false)

    • getPrevHeight

      public double getPrevHeight()

    • getPrevWidth

      public double getPrevWidth()

    • coorToGrid

      public int[] coorToGrid​(double xCoor, double yCoor)
      change the actual coordinate system to the grid coordinate
      Parameters:
      xCoor - x coordinate of the creature
      yCoor - y coordinate of the creature
      Returns:
      int array that has length 2. first index would be x grid coordinate, and second index would be y grid coordinate.

    • gridToCoor

      public double[] gridToCoor​(int xGrid, int yGrid)
      change the grid coordinate system to the actual coordinate
      Parameters:
      xGrid - x grid coordinate of the creature
      yGrid - y grid coordinate of the creature
      Returns:
      double array that has length 2. first index would be x actual coordinate, and second index would be y actual coordinate.

    • destinationDir

      public int destinationDir​(int[] destination)
      Parameters:
      destination - the x and y coordinate where
      Returns:
      the direction toward the destination
      Precondition:
      destination has to be in the grid, not the bound exception, and it has to be length 2 int array

    • draw

      public void draw​(DrawingSurface g)
      It will draw the creature on the drawing surface. If the image is null, the gray rectangle with the description of the crature would be drawn. If the image is not null, the image will be drawn. The drawing would be completed upward left coordinate (getX(), getY()) to getWidth() and getHeight(). Not only drawing the creatures, it will update the value of x and y and width and height if the screen width and height are changed. If the grid is not set yet, it will do nothing
      Parameters:
      g - Drawing surface object that the creature will be drawan on
      Precondition:
      Drawing Surface has to be not the null
      Postcondition:
      g.fill() would be set to 0(black) if the image is null.

    • canStand

      public boolean canStand​(double xCoor, double yCoor)
      Check if the input x coordinate and y coordinate are standable or not
      Parameters:
      xCoor - the left side x coordinate of the creature
      yCoor - the up side y coordinate of the creature
      Returns:
      if the (xCoor, yCoor) is null, or out of bounds in the island, or if the bottom left and bottom right of the creature is not standable, it will return false. otherwise, it will return true.

    • act

      public void act​(int dir)
      It will move once in a while in random direction if the dir is -1 If the direction is set specifically, it will move into the direction If the grid is not set yet, it will do nothing
      Parameters:
      dir - the direction that the creature will move to (no matter horizontal or vertical. but not a diagonal)

    • act

      public abstract void act()
      The specified random movement of the creatures

    • getType

      public abstract java.lang.String getType()
      Returns:
      the String that describe the type of the creatures (Circe, Pig, Visitor...)
